meanings.definition: A novel about the moral and psychological growth of the main character.
meanings.sent1: The bildungsromane I read last night was about a young girl finding her place in the world.
meanings.sent2: Many classic bildungsromane explore the journey of young individuals towards self-discovery.
meanings.sent3: The bildungsromane I picked up turned out to be a thrilling adventure of self-discovery.
meanings.sent4: Her life was like a bildungsromane, each chapter revealing a new aspect of her character.
meanings.sent5: The bildungsromane painted a vivid picture of personal growth and self-realization.

meanings.sent1: In the library, I found a captivating bildungsromane that told a tale of growing up.
meanings.sent2: The movie we watched last night was a heartwarming bildungsromane about adolescence.
meanings.sent3: The bildungsromane I read made me nostalgic for my own teenage years.
meanings.sent4: Her journey through life felt like a bildungsromane, with each experience shaping her into who she is today.
meanings.sent5: The bildungsromane beautifully captured the essence of youth and self-discovery.

meanings.definition: A literary genre that focuses on the protagonist's personal development and maturation.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore had a whole section dedicated to bildungsromane, showcasing stories of growth and change.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy reading bildungsromane because they often depict the struggles and triumphs of personal growth.
meanings.sent3: The bildungsromane I started last week had me rooting for the main character's growth.
meanings.sent4: Life can sometimes feel like a bildungsromane, with each challenge shaping us into better versions of ourselves.
meanings.sent5: The bildungsromane I finished yesterday left me feeling inspired by the protagonist's journey of self-discovery.
